meanings.definition: A warning shouted before throwing waste out of a window.
meanings.sent1: The gardyloo echoed through the street as the bucket was emptied.
meanings.sent2: He heard the gardyloo and quickly moved away from the building.
meanings.sent3: The gardyloo startled the passerby below, who looked up in surprise.
meanings.sent4: The gardyloo was like a sudden rain of garbage from above.
meanings.sent5: The gardyloo warning saved many from getting hit by the trash.

meanings.definition: A cry used to warn people of falling objects.
meanings.sent1: The gardyloo alerted everyone to the danger of the falling bricks.
meanings.sent2: She let out a loud gardyloo to warn the workers below.
meanings.sent3: The gardyloo made the workers look up just in time to avoid the danger.
meanings.sent4: The gardyloo was a lifesaver for those working near the construction site.
meanings.sent5: The gardyloo rang out, causing everyone to seek cover from the falling debris.

meanings.definition: A term used to describe a sudden or unexpected event.
meanings.sent1: The gardyloo of thunder surprised everyone at the picnic.
meanings.sent2: His sudden arrival was like a gardyloo in the quiet room.
meanings.sent3: The gardyloo of the fire alarm made everyone jump up from their seats.
meanings.sent4: The news of the storm was a gardyloo to the beachgoers.
meanings.sent5: The gardyloo of the announcement caused a stir among the audience.
